text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Tuesday:
- The university of the Italian-speaking part of Switzerland was opened Monday. The new institution has three faculties: economics, architecture and communication.
- Some 50 percent of all 2,704 Swiss persons who became unemployed in September were between 15 and 24 years old, the Federal Office for Statistics said.
- Two leading Swiss trade unions, GBI and SMUV, announced plans to cooperate. They also said that they wished to cooperate with other trade unions as well.
- Swissair ground staff is facing a three percent cut in wages in 1997, and bonuses will be reduced significantly. Weekly working hours will be reduced from 42 to 41 hours.
- Swiss president Jean-Pascal Delamuraz met Luxembourg's Prime Minister Jean-Claude Junker in Berne to discuss bilateral negotiations between Switzerland and Europe.
- Representatives of the European Union expressed disappointment that Switzerland has not yet accepted a compromise with respect to free-flow of persons within Europe.
